definition: old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)

sentences.english: In the front of the shaoxing work received the letter, sister szabics with myriad heart.
sentences.chinese: 在前方的绍功收到了妹妹绍英的来信，心中慨叹万千。

sentences.english: They both bewailed their misfortune at being young, unmarried returned students.
sentences.chinese: 两人慨叹不幸身为青年未婚留学生的麻烦。

sentences.english: We gazed up at the cloudless blue sky, marvelling in the magnificence and beauty of it all.
sentences.chinese: 仰视蓝天，万里无云，恢宏的美景让我们慨叹万千。

sentences.english: This is pansophy greatly wise sighing with regret.
If only, they lament, the government would give them the means to do something about it.
sentences.chinese: 他们慨叹，要是政府会给出办法为此做些事情就好了。

sentences.english: Today i am standing here, humbled, because i know that our climb will be deep.
sentences.chinese: 今天我站在这里，为我们将面对的任重道远而慨叹。

sentences.english: We sigh too much speaking of the changeable fate.
sentences.chinese: 对于命运的变化无常，我们慨叹得太多了。

definition: to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to wring one's hands (literally wring one's wrists)
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
